reviews.text: There is a manned ticket office here. Clean facilities and inside waiting area as well as outside shelter. There is a 'butty box' just outside the station but unfortunately not open today.
A quiet little station, parking was fine, waiting room was warm, minus 1 star as the food van wasn't open (Saturday lunchtime)

A quiet, rural railway station with only a handful of stopping services, meaning that there are not too many trains to film. Gets 4 stars rather than 3 due to the great scenery surrounding Castle Cary station

Know this small train station since,, 1967, that's 50 years 

You would think by now that for us who have problems using the footbridge, another means, other than having to ring ahead to be escorted across the tracks would have long ago been put into place, each time I travel down from London 

Shame on the district council.

Asked for a Bacon roll in the station car park. I had 19 minutes till my train. When it was down to 4 minutes left,  I mentioned that I only had 4 minutes till my train. My food was cooked,  so no issue,  I thought! The gentleman serving me said,  why didn't you f*****g tell me. I said,  it's OK not a problem as it's ready. He told me to f**k off and gave me my money back. He continued swearing at me as I walked off,  (hungry). Lovely chap ! 🤣🤣🤣
